title-group.article-title: Regulators' Decisions on Rates of Return: Recent Experience in the Telephone Industry

abstract.p: Regulators' decisions on allowed rates of return for public utilities have important implications, but there is little empirical analysis of actual decisions. This paper examines rate of return decisions related to telephone utilities. In a sample of 206 cases from 1976-1984, such decisions were affected by conditions in the capital markets and by company-specific risk variables. Allowed rates of return on equity were not related to capital structure--a finding at odds with financial theory. Allowed returns were inversely related to debt ratios, which encourages equity financing by regulated firms.
